caption: Table 1: Details of the selected datasets¹.
description: This table presents the details of the four datasets used in the paper's experiments.  It shows the dataset name, the original size of the dataset in megabytes (MB), and the number of 3D models contained within each dataset. The datasets include human models (AMA), animal models (DT4D), CAD models (Thingi10K), and a mixed dataset containing models from all three previous datasets.

caption: Table 2: Quantitative comparisons of different RGRs.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of two different regular geometry representation methods: TSDF and TSDF-Def.  The comparison is based on compression ratio, size, Chamfer distance (CD), Normal Consistency (NC), F1-score at thresholds of 0.005 and 0.01. Lower CD indicates better reconstruction accuracy, while higher NC and F1-scores represent better surface reconstruction. The table aims to demonstrate the advantages of TSDF-Def over TSDF.

caption: Table 3: Quantitative comparisons of different resolutions of TSDF-Def volumes.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of using different resolutions (64, 128, and 256) for TSDF-Def volumes in the NeCGS model.  It shows the resulting compressed file size (in MB), compression ratio, Chamfer Distance (CD), Normal Consistency (NC), F-Score (at thresholds 0.005 and 0.01), optimization time (in hours), and inference time (in milliseconds).  The results demonstrate the trade-off between compression effectiveness and computational cost at various resolutions.
